result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon D Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Straight Time. Sentence credit of 5 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

May terminate probation after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent.  May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.
 Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valide driver's license. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brandon D Washington in court with Attorney Anna M Kees.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Coun t#1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kees makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME (CREDIT - 5 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR   * May terminate after 6 months, if deemed appropriate by agent*   **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license ro Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($100.00) and remainder due as a condition of probation)  

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 27, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Anna M Kees in court.   Defendant Brandon D Washington did not appear.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kees requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
to appear filed by Attorney Anna Kees

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Brandon D Washington in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney Kees will be appointed.  Court will quash the warrant.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant Brandon D Washington not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Brandon D Washington not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant called the Clerk's office and is not able to appear as he had no ride to court.  Court authorizes and stays a warrant until the next hearing.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:00 am.
